references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational Quasi-Bayesian methodology that the current work builds upon, providing a new paradigm in Bayesian computation.
This paper is the first to propose the recursive Bayesian predictive distribution, a key concept underlying the Quasi-Bayesian methods used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Evading the curse of dimensionality in nonparametric density estimation with simplified vine copulas
references.reason: This paper introduces vine copulas, a crucial element of the proposed QB-Vine model, and demonstrates their effectiveness in high-dimensional density estimation.

references.paper_title: Analyzing dependent data with vine copulas
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of vine copulas, which are essential to understanding the QB-Vine model and its implementation.

references.paper_title: A kernel method for the two-sample-problem
references.reason: This paper introduces the Maximum Mean Discrepancy (MMD), a crucial concept used for evaluating the performance of the QB-Vine model and comparing it to other methods.
